remarks: Part of proof of part 12 in [Baer] p. 49 line 4.  The sigma map of a negative is the negative of the sigma map.  (Contributed by NM, 24-May-2015.)
statement:
hdmap12b.h $e |- H = ( LHyp ` K ) $.
hdmap12b.u $e |- U = ( ( DVecH ` K ) ` W ) $.
hdmap12b.v $e |- V = ( Base ` U ) $.
hdmap12b.m $e |- M = ( invg ` U ) $.
hdmap12b.c $e |- C = ( ( LCDual ` K ) ` W ) $.
hdmap12b.i $e |- I = ( invg ` C ) $.
hdmap12b.s $e |- S = ( ( HDMap ` K ) ` W ) $.
hdmap12b.k $e |- ( ph -> ( K e. HL /\ W e. H ) ) $.
hdmap12b.x $e |- ( ph -> T e. V ) $.
hdmapneg $p |- ( ph -> ( S ` ( M ` T ) ) = ( I ` ( S ` T ) ) ) $.
